segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā vaṅgīso āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye āyasmatā nigrodhakappena upajjhāyena saddhiṃ.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Vaṅgīsa was staying near Āḷavī, at the Aggāḷava Tree-shrine, together with his mentor, Venerable Nigrodhakappa.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā vaṅgīso navako hoti acirapabbajito ohiyyako vihārapālo.
segments.en: Now at that time Vaṅgīsa was junior, recently gone forth. He had been left behind to look after the dwelling.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā itthiyo samalaṅkaritvā yena aggāḷavako ārāmo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu vihārapekkhikāyo.
segments.en: Then several women dressed in all their finery went to the monastery at Aggāḷava in order to inspect the dwelling.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmato vaṅgīsassa tā itthiyo disvā anabhirati uppajjati, rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti.
segments.en: When Vaṅgīsa saw them he became dissatisfied, with lust infecting his mind.

segments.pli: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ;
yassa me anabhirati uppannā, rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti, taṃ kutettha labbhā, yaṃ me paro anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyya.
segments.en: that I’ve become dissatisfied, with lust infecting my mind. How is it possible for someone else to dispel my discontent and give rise to satisfaction?

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ attanāva attano anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyyan”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I do it myself?”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā vaṅgīso attanāva attano anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādetvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
segments.en: Then, on the occasion of dispelling his own discontent and giving rise to satisfaction, he recited these verses:
by the impudent thoughts of the Dark One.
Even if a thousand mighty princes and great archers,
for I stand firm in the teaching.
I heard this with my own ears
from the Buddha, Kinsman of the Sun,
about the path going to extinguishment;
Wicked One, if you come near me
I’ll make sure that you, Death,
won’t even see the path I take.”

suttaplex.blurb: Enticed by the sight of beautiful women, the newly ordained monk Vaṅgīsa dispels desire and celebrates his commitment to the spiritual path in verse.
